text: Consider a relation R(A, B) that contains 100 tuples, and a relation S(B, C) that contains 80 tuples; Make no assumptions about keys & assume that the domain of all attributes is integers. Consider the following relational algebra expression: TI'BR — (WBR — TFBS) Let m be the minimum and M be the maximum number of tuples that could be in the result of the above expression, then m + M? goclasses2023-mockgate-2 numerical-answers Gf-goclasses databases relational-algebra 2-marks
